title: MdCheckbox + ServerModule - Cannot read property 'trim' of undefined
Animations rerunning with ngrx redux binding
body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

When I update the value bindings after clicking I expect that animations only to be run on controls that have changed.


#### What is the current behavior?

With different form controls (the toggle slider and range slider are the ones I know for sure) the animation is rerun every time the input value binding changes. Not only when the value has changed as you would expect but also when the value is the same.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

I have tried reproducing in a simple form on plunker but I'm not sure I'll be able to do with without implementing ngrx, simply binding to a BehaviourSubject didn't work.


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?

I have a set of control values bound to an input value object. With redux the entire object is replaced each time one of the values changes. This seems to trigger the extra animations.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

I'm using Angular V4.0, ngrx core V1.2.0, ngrx store V2.2.2, material V2.0.0-beta.8

title: feat(datepicker): export unexported components for potential extension
body: Although the team has export those files, but users can't redeclare them in another NgModule for angular constraints. It's impossible for someone to extend the functionality or create a custom date(time)picker view without this patch.

title: fix(xxx-intl): replace misused EventEmitter with Subject
body: According to https://angular.io/api/core/EventEmitter#description, EventEmitter is not for services. And Subject is preferrable.

title: improve the document and add more examples?
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:

proposal

#### What is the expected behavior?

e.g `md-table`, improve the document about `DataBase` and `DataSource`.

Can I use `DataService` instead of `DataBase`?
Can I use Component class  `extends` the `abstract class DataSource` ? I don't want to create a new `DataSource` class.

#### What is the current behavior?

https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/material-examples/table-http/table-http-example.ts

1. I am confused why use `dataBase`(`ExampleHttpDao`) rather than a `DataService`?

2. And the `DataSource`, can I just return an Observable of `DataSerivce` within `ngOnInit` of 
 a Component?

like this: 

ts:
```ts
ngOnInit() {
   this.dataSource$ = this.someService.getAll();
}
```
html:
```html
<md-table [dataSource]='dataSource'>

</md-table>
```

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?

I am confused how to add I new item to the items of `md-table` dataSource. 
when I create a new item, how do I put this new item to the items of dataSource. And the `md-table` display the new item at the head?

I think below is easy to understand when I create a new data and add to my data list.
ts: 
```ts
ngOnInit() {
  this.someService.getAll().subscribe((datas) => {
    this.datas = datas;
  });
}

create() {
  this.someService.create().subscribe((data) => {
     this.datas.unshift(data);
  }) 
}
```

html:
```html
<md-table>
   <tr *ngFor='let data of datas'>
     //...
   </tr>
</md-table>
```

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

`"@angular/core": "^4.3.3",`
`"@angular/material": "^2.0.0-beta.8",`

title: chore(build): add examples to docs build and annotate table examples
body: This PR adds the examples module build to the docs build chain and adds annotations for the missing table examples.

title: Align TemplatePortal with ComponentPortal and support context in TemplateRef Dialogs
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: proposal #### What is the expected behavior? `TemplatePortal` should accept a context which then allows using the `MdDialogConfig.data` as context for a dialog opened using a `TemplateRef`. #### What is the current behavior? `TemplatePortal` does no accepts context. It does accept `locals` but these were added within the first commit and never used. #### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? There are several... First, `TemplatePortal` is not aligned with `ComponentPortal`. Since both provide the same logical functionality it makes sense to return the same logical object: `ComponentRef`, `EmbeddedViewRef`. In addition, `TemplatePortal` does not allow sending data (context) to the template. There is a place holder (`locals`) property but it is never used. `TemplatePortal` is not responsible for the structure of the context so `locals` as `Map` is not a proper type, instead a generic type is more suited. The consumer of `TemplatePortal` should decide about the structure (e.g. using `$implicit`? what local to expose etc...) Once `TemplatePortal` support context, `MdDialog` can provide same experience for both **Component** based dialogs and `TemplateRef` based dialogs. `MdDialog` will auto crete the context have the `MdDialogConfig.data` as `$implicit` and an extra property `dialogRef` exposed (which holds `MdDialogRef`). This create a powerful combination of a template that has access to injected data (context) and local template variables of its **parent** template. It allows passing template references throughout the application with the ability to have data injected. It's a more declarative approach with a lot of power. For example, using the `demo-app` code, **without changing TS code** we can provide the same functionality (almost) that the **demo-jazz-dialog** component provide just by changing the html only. ```html I'm a template dialog. I've been opened {{numTemplateOpens}} times!

It's Jazz!

{{ data.message }}

` ``` This template uses bindings from 3 sources, the context, local template variables of the parent component and the component instance itself. With simple structured directives it will be possible to create template driven UI blockers, modal etc... that accepts data and are set elsewhere. I'v started to work on this change, [see the diff](https://github.com/angular/material2/compare/master...shlomiassaf:refactor-TemplatePortal?expand=1) The change is not big but having TemplatePortal now with a generic required some mods, and it's also a breaking change so it's needs discussion. Please comment. cc @jelbourn Thanks.

title: test(): screenshot diff for opened dialog
body: * Creates a screenshot for a simple opened dialog

title: test(): screenshot diff for toolbar
body: * Adds the toolbar demo to the e2e app and adds a screenshot diff for it.

title: build: disallow usage of HostBinding and HostListener
body:
Adds the `HostBinding` and `HostListener` decorators to the banned symbols list for consistency's sake. Refactors the handful of places that were using them.

Relates to #6304.

title: fix(overlay): error when removing empty string theme
body: Something I ran into while doing #6305. If the previous overlay theme is a blank string, switching to another theme throws an error.

title: build: toggle demo app dark theme for overlay components
body: Fixes the dark theme not being added to overlay-based components.

title: bug(tabs): fix arrows not showing on reszize #6303
body: Addresses https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/6303

title: Tab Header Arrows Not Showing on Resize
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
When the browser resizes and the tabs are cut off, the arrows would appear and vice versa.

#### What is the current behavior?
Currently when the page is resize, the arrows are not shown until 
https://www.screencast.com/t/9MWHdRYsfpIv

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Open a large set of tabs but doesn't spill over the screen.
2. Resize your screen so the tabs are cut off.
3. Note the arrows to show the overflown content are NOT visible
4. Click a tab and they appear

title: fix(select,autocomplete): darken selected option
body:
Darkens the selected option background in order to distinguish it from the ones that are focused or hovered.

Fixes #6229.

title: chore: add cdk table to universal app
body: * Adds the CDK table to the universal app. This ensures that CDK tables can be rendered inside of platform-server.

title: build: deploy screenshot app for push builds
body:
* Currently only the screenshot functions are deployed, but not he screenshot application. With this change the application will be also deployed on Travis Push builds.

**Note**:  This should fix cases where the screenshot application serves the demo-app (https://material2-screenshots.firebaseapp.com/)

Related to #6286

title: fix(tooltip): update tooltip template to allow HTML
body: There is often a need to add HTML to tooltips, specifically line breaks.

title: md-tab-group: Can not hide md-tab-header
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
**Maybe a Bug:**
I'd like to hide the default tab header, because i use a custom tab navigation.
However the template ignores any added CSS.

#### What is the expected behavior?
Using the chrome debugger, you can figure out that CSS with
`md-tab-header { display: none; }`
should hide the whole header. 

#### What is the current behavior?
CSS is ignored, maybe it is straight overwritten. Using `!important` doesn't have any effect.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
All changes in app.component.html
http://plnkr.co/edit/j9uHPAB4Olz8sOLa6lEY

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Allow to use tabs with a custom tab navigation

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
"@angular/common": "^4.3.2",
"@angular/material": "^2.0.0-beta.8",
"typescript": "~2.4.2"
Tested on Chrome, Firefox, Safari

#### Is there anything else we should know?
-

title: Add complex tabs example
body:
Replaces the 'Coming Soon!' example with an advanced tab example showing:

- Different content sizes
- Tab HTML Labels
- Disabled Tabs
- Tab Header Overflow

title: feat(tabs): add swipe events #2209
body: Addresses #2209 by adding swipe events to the tab content area.

title: fix(dialog): support passing in dialog result through all MdDialogClose selectors
body:
Fixes not being able to pass in a dialog result through the `mdDialogClose`, `matDialogClose` and `mat-dialog-close` selectors, even though they are allowed by the `MdDialogClose` directive.

Fixes #6278.

title: TypeError: this._getHostElement(...).focus is not a function
body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
Using [this guide](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/wiki/stories-universal-rendering) I would like to be able render app without errors.

#### What is the current behavior?
Currently I'm recieving error:
```
ERROR { Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: this._getHostElement(...).focus is not a function
TypeError: this._getHostElement(...).focus is not a function
    at MdOption.focus (home_path/node_modules/@angular/material/bundles/material.umd.js:1638:32)
    at FocusKeyManager.setActiveItem (home_path/node_modules/@angular/material/bundles/material.umd.js:6787:29)
    at MdSelect._selectValue (home_path/node_modules/@angular/material/bundles/material.umd.js:7454:30)
    at MdSelect._setSelectionByValue (home_path/node_modules/@angular/material/bundles/material.umd.js:7431:18)
    at MdSelect.writeValue (home_path/node_modules/@angular/material/bundles/material.umd.js:7237:18)
    at home_path/node_modules/@angular/forms/bundles/forms.umd.js:1810:29
    at home_path/node_modules/@angular/forms/bundles/forms.umd.js:2996:65
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at FormControl.setValue (home_path/node_modules/@angular/forms/bundles/forms.umd.js:2996:28)
    at home_path/node_modules/@angular/forms/bundles/forms.umd.js:4398:60
    at resolvePromise (home_path/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-node.js:783:31)
    at home_path/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-node.js:834:17
    at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (home_path/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-node.js:424:31)
    at Object.onInvokeTask (home_path/node_modules/@angular/core/bundles/core.umd.js:3913:33)
    at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (home_path/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-node.js:423:36)
    at Zone.runTask (home_path/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-node.js:191:47)
    at drainMicroTaskQueue (home_path/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-node.js:595:35)
    at ZoneTask.invokeTask (home_path/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-node.js:502:21)
    at ZoneTask.invoke (home_path/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-node.js:487:48)
    at data.args.(anonymous function) (home_path/node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-node.js:1063:25)
```
However, I'm still able to produce out html.
#### What are the steps to reproduce?
I have these [modules](https://gist.github.com/GuskiS/61285100e06b9226f0412a5e8ebbac75)
Looking at the error message it seems that select is causing this, so here is my select:
Example code:
```
...
  buttons = ["left", "middle", "right"]
  button = this.buttons[0]
...
  <md-select (change)="change()" [(ngModel)]="button">
    <md-option *ngFor="let mb of buttons" [value]="mb">{{ mb | uppercase }}</md-option>
  </md-select>
...
```
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular - 4.3.3
Material - 2.0.0-beta.8
OS - Ubuntu 16.10
TypeScript - 2.4.2

#### Is there anything else we should know?
For some reason `Current document does not have a doctype. This may cause some Angular Material components not to behave as expected.` is outputed, however, I do have `doctype`.

title: fix(input): not working correctly in high contrast mode
body:
Fixes the input not working correctly in high contrast mode by:
* Using a margin instead of a border to do the spacing inside the input. Windows renders all borders in high contrast mode, even if they're transparent, which caused the input to have a 5px top border.
* Using a border to render the underline, instead of a background color.
* Hiding the ripple, because it was causing the underline to blend in with the background.

Also gets rid of an unused method.

Relates to #6257.

title: build: version placeholder replacement grep alternative
body:
For the version placeholde replacement a Grep statement is used as well. For Windows environments there is an alternative called `Findstr` which can be used to avoid having a dependency on ported Unix-tools.

References https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/6211

title: feat(dialog): open dialog API improvements
body:
* Makes the `openDialog` public.
* Adds a unique id to each `MdDialogRef`, as well as the option to override the id and to look dialogs up by id.
* The `afterAllClosed` stream now emits on subscribe if there are no open dialogs.

Fixes #6272.

title: build: fix error when running devapp on windows
body:
Currently developers using Windows are not able to serve the devapp because the secondary entry-points can't be resolved. This can happen because of two things:

* `egrep`, which is an alias for `grep -E` is not part of the global `$PATH` variable on Windows
* The Regular Expression for the `grep` call is ambiguous and expects zero-width characters to be present.

This PR changes the `spawnSync` call to use `grep -E` and also changes the Regular Expression to be more explicit about what characters to match after the `from`.

In reality it's still not really clear what characters was causing the RegExp to no longer match, or if it was more caused by the fact that NodeJS somehow tries to escape the quote in a bad way.

cc. @crisbeto

title: chore(dialog): switch to OnPush change detection
body:
Switches the dialog to OnPush change detection.

**Note:** This is the same changeset as #5422. I've had to reopen it since it wasn't possible to rebase #6126.

title: chore: fix missing types error for screenshot-tool functions
body:
The Google Cloud functions for the screenshot-test tool can't be deployed on the CI because there appear to be some errors that indicate that the types for the `jsonwebtoken` package are not installed.

This commit adds the types for the `jsonwebtoken` package to the dependencies (similar as for the dashboard)

title: build: fix docs generation highlight files task
body:
Recently with https://github.com/angular/material2/commit/edcbb24f11ae776b94d97634ae91e9175ffd6f8a the ambigious variable `path` has been renamed to `filePath`, but there is one remaining instance of `path` that didn't get updated.

This currently causes the docs-content CI job to fail.
